metadata.title: CVE-2019-11691 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability can occur when working with XMLHttpRequest(XHR) in an event loop, causing the XHR main thread to be called after ithas been freed. This results in a potentially exploitable crash. Thisvulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.7, Firefox < 67, and Firefox ESR <60.7.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11691` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
